item.description:
According to the New England Mountain Bicycle Association Fort Rock is the commonly known name for two separate Town Forests, the Henderson-Swasey Town Forest (250 acres)and the Oakland Town Forest (352 acres) both in Exeter. They are separated by Route 101. Joining them together is a large metal culvert that runs under the highway allowing you to access all of the trails in both Town Forests from where ever you enter either Forest .


We will according to the map on the kiosk be completing a 5.1 mile loop in the Oaklands Town Forest. The loop is composed of old roads, some snowmobile trails, and single track mountain bike sections. Parts of the old roads are more rocky as the road beds have eroded so aren't exactly flat but wider.  We will also be crossing over some boardwalks over boggy ponds.

Map links

Oakland: http://www.town.exeter.nh.us/sites.default.files.fileattachments/oaklands_towns_forest_brochure.pdf

Henderson-Swasey:http://town.exeter.nh.us/conserve/henderson%20swasey%20map.pdf

Link to a description of Fort Rock from the perspective of a mountain biker.

http://www.nemba.org/ridingzone/Fort_Rock.html

The perspective of a parent with kids:

http://outdoorsmom.hubpages.com/hub/Hiking-With-Kids-Fort-Rock-Exeter-NH

A video of a bike ride:

http://vimeo.com/25577628

Photo album of a previous hike here:

http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/7303132/113737212/#108486112

Any adult guest you want to bring should sign up on the meetup site as a member so they will be covered by the liability waiver. A minor would need a written waiver signed by a parent or guardian

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Heading 101 East get off at Exit Ten and turn left at the end of the ramp. Proceed 0.2 miles passing the mailbox for 34 Newfields Road on the left. The sign for the town forest is just past the mailbox on the left..

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Oaklands Town Forest
